meanings.definition: Of or relating to a crypt
meanings.sent1: The cryptal chamber was dark and mysterious.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tomb had a cryptal atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The cryptal shadows seemed to whisper secrets.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes held a cryptal depth, hiding untold stories.
meanings.sent5: The cryptal aura of the graveyard sent shivers down his spine.

meanings.sent1: The cryptal design of the building gave it a spooky look.
meanings.sent2: The old cellar had a cryptal appearance with its stone walls.
meanings.sent3: The cryptal pattern on the wallpaper made it look like a hidden passage.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a cryptal quality, echoing like whispers in a tomb.
meanings.sent5: The cryptal facade of the house made it stand out in the neighborhood.

meanings.sent1: The cryptal artifacts were carefully preserved underground.
meanings.sent2: The cryptal inscriptions on the walls told stories of the past.
meanings.sent3: The cryptal silence of the underground chamber was eerie yet calming.
meanings.sent4: His cryptal hideout provided the perfect refuge from the storm.
meanings.sent5: The cryptal echoes in the crypt made it feel like a hidden world.
